question:
Sections 153 A and Sections 295 A of Indian Penal Code (IPC) were recently making news. Consider the following statements with this reference:
  1. Section 153A punishes injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class.
  2. Section 295A punishes those who promote enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc. and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony. 
Which of the above is / are correct statements?
explanation: These provisions were introduced to maintain the religious harmony in the country and to uphold the diversity. The provisions in the above statements are interchanged Section 153A  punishes those who promote enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc. and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony and Section 295A punishes injuring or defiling place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class.
